p: To some extent COVID-19 outbreak may be considered as an indirect consequence of global environmental changes ( 77). In fact, multiscale environmental changes encompassing social processes, such as over-crowded urban settings where human and wildlife can come into close contact (e.g., wet markets), trading of exotic animals ( 6), large-scale population migration, such as those linked to the Chinese New Year celebration ( 78), were identified as possible causes of the emergence of COVID-19 and of its pandemic spread.
